sen.e: MINAMOTO no Moronaka (1116 - May 16, 1172) was a noble and poet who lived in the late Heian Period.

sen.j: 村上源氏の権中納言源師時（左大臣源俊房の子、『長秋記』作者）の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of MINAMOTO no Morotoki (a son of MINAMOTO no Toshifusa, who was Sadaijin (minister of the left), and the author of "Choshuki" (diary of MINAMOTO no Morotoki), who was Gon Dainagon and from Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Iwashimizu Betto (Head of the Iwashimuzu Hachiman Shrine) Kosei and MINAMOTO no Masanaka was his son.

sen.j: 後白河上皇の院政に参画、その一翼を担う有力な廷臣となるが、藤原信西と対立したことからその政敵である藤原信頼に接近する。
sen.e: He took part in Insei (cloister government) by the Retired Emperor Goshirakawa and played an important part as an influential court official, but, as he confronted with FUJIWARA no Shinzei, he moved toward FUJIWARA no Nobuyori, who was a political opponent of Shinzei.

sen.j: 信西打倒のための武力蜂起計画が進行する過程で、伏見の自領を信頼の武芸の訓練のために提供するなど、深く謀議に関与している。
sen.e: In the course of development of a plan for armed uprising to overthrow Shinzei, he was deeply involved in the plot as seen in the fact that he offered his fief in Fushimi to Nobuyori for training of martial art.

sen.j: 平治元年(1159年)、かねてからの計画通り信頼や源義朝らとともに挙兵（平治の乱）。
sen.e: In 1159, together with Nobuyori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, he raised an army as planned (Heiji Disturbance).

sen.j: 上皇と上西門院を内裏に幽閉するに当たり、その護送用の車を用意するという任務を果たしている。
sen.e: In confining Retired Emperor and Josaimonin in Dairi (Imperial Palace), he played a role to prepare vehicles for transporting them under guard.

sen.j: 当初、戦局は信頼方に有利に展開するが、藤原惟方・藤原経宗らが敵方に寝返り二条天皇を内裏から脱出させたことから状況は一変、上皇も脱出し、信頼らは一転して賊軍としての立場に追い込まれる。
sen.e: In the beginning, the state of war developed preferably to the Nobuyori's side, but the situation drastically changed as FUJIWARA no Korekata and FUJIWARA no Tsunemune deserted to the enemy and made the Emperor Nijo escape from the Dairi, and the Retired Emperor escaped and Nobuyori and his allies were driven into a corner as rebel army.

sen.j: こうした情勢を見て師仲は、味方陣中にあった三種の神器の一つである八咫鏡などを自らの手中に納め、早くも降伏を想定した保身行動に入っていたとされる。
sen.e: Reportedly, Moronaka, who judged from such situations, held in his hand Yata no Kagami (the eight-span mirror), which was one of the three sacred emblems of the imperial family as a measure for self-protection taking surrender into consideration.

sen.j: やがて信頼・義朝らの敗戦を見届けた後、神鏡を姉小路東洞院にあった自邸に保管し、自らは六波羅に出頭する。
sen.e: After having seen defeat of Nobuyori and Yoshitomo, he kept the sacred mirror in this residence in Aneyakoji Higashi no Toin and he himself appeared to Rokuhara.
